msection.title: Description
msection.p: This task provides an interface to Subversion revision control system that is a compelling replacement for CVS in the open source community.
The setup of these external tasks can be studied here.

msection.title: Parameters
msection.p: The following parameters are supported by the svn task:

attribute.name: logFile
attribute.doc: Write the output of the commands into the log file instead of the console.

attribute.name: refid
attribute.doc: If set the configuration for this task is taken from a svnSetting object. Such a settings instance simply provides default values, so they will be overridden in case the corresponding attribute on this task has been set.

msection.title: Svn commands specified as nested elements
Examples
msection.p: checkouts a working copy from repository
msection.snippet: <svn> <delete> <fileset dir="workingcopy/deleteTest"> <include name="**/*.del"/> </fileset> </delete> <commit message="commit deleted files" dir="workingcopy/deleteTest"/> </svn>
msection.p: deletes some files from repository (and commit changes)
msection.snippet: <svn> <add dir="workingcopy/propTest"/> <commit message="propTest added" dir="workingcopy/propTest"/> <propset path="workingcopy/propTest/file.png" name="svn:mime-type" value="image/png" /> <propset path="workingcopy/propTest/file.png" name="myPicture" file="workingcopy/propTest/icon.gif" /> </svn>
msection.p: add my_repos/propTest to repository and set two properties on file.png
subversion command line interface is used (javahl="false").
msection.snippet: <svnSetting svnkit="true" username="bingo" password="bongo" id="svn.settings" /> ... <svn refid="svn.settings" failonerror="false"> ... </svn>
msection.p: Declaration of basic subversion settings and their reference. This little snippet also shows that a setting can be overriden in the end (failonerror).
